concept.title: Interactive Configuration Reference for the tc Server Module
concept.shortdesc: This section describes each prompt when entering into interactive configuration mode of the HTTP Session Management Module for tc Server.

conbody.codeblock: Please enter a value for 'geode-cs.maximum.vm.heap.size.mb'. Default '512': Please enter a value for 'geode-cs.initial.vm.heap.size.mb'. Default '512': Please enter a value for 'geode-cs.cms.initiating.heap.percentage'. Default '50':
conbody.p: The above properties allow you to fine-tune your JVM heap and garbage collector. For more information, refer to .
conbody.codeblock: Please specify whether to enable a Geode listener that logs session create, update, destroy and expiration events. Default 'false':
conbody.p: The above property determines whether a debug cache listener is added to the session region. When true, info-level messages are logged to the log when sessions are created, updated, invalidated, or expired.
conbody.codeblock:
With the geode-p2p template: Please specify whether to maintain a local Geode cache. Default 'false':
With the geode-cs template: Please specify whether to maintain a local Geode cache. Default 'true':
conbody.p: The above property determines whether a local cache is enabled; if this parameter is set to true, the app server load balancer should be configured for sticky session mode.
conbody.codeblock:
With the geode-p2p template: Please enter the id of the attributes of the Geode region used to cache sessions. Default 'REPLICATE':
With the geode-cs template: Please enter the id of the attributes of the Geode region used to cache sessions. Default 'PARTITION_REDUNDANT':
conbody.p: The above property determines the ID of the attributes for the cache region; possible values include PARTITION, PARTITION_REDUNDANT, PARTITION_PERSISTENT, REPLICATE, REPLICATE_PERSISTENT, and any other region shortcut that can be found in . When using a partitioned region attribute, it is recommended that you use PARTITION_REDUNDANT (rather than PARTITION) to ensure that the failure of a server does not result in lost session data.
conbody.codeblock: Please enter the name of the Geode region used to cache sessions. Default 'gemfire_modules_sessions':
conbody.p: The above property determines the region name.
conbody.codeblock: Please enter the port that Tomcat Shutdown should listen on. Default '-1': Please enter the port that the JMX socket listener should listen on. Default '6969':
conbody.p: The above properties are application server properties.
conbody.codeblock: Please enter a value for 'bio.http.port'. Default '8080': Please enter a value for 'bio.https.port'. Default '8443':
conbody.p: tc Server requires information about connector ports. bio.http.port is the http port for tc Server and bio.https.port is the secure http port for tc Server.
conbody.codeblock:
With the geode-p2p template: Please enter the name of the Geode cache configuration file. Default 'cache-peer.xml':
With the geode-cs template: Please enter the name of the Geode cache configuration file. Default 'cache-client.xml':
conbody.p: You can change the name of the cache configuration file with the above property. If you do change this value, be sure to include an xml file by that name in the conf subdirectory.
conbody.codeblock: Please enter the percentage of heap at which updates to the cache are refused. 0.0 means disabled. Default '0.0': Please enter the percentage of heap at which sessions will be evicted from the local cache. Default '80.0':
conbody.p: The above properties allow you to control the critical and eviction watermarks for the heap. By default, the critical watermark is disabled (set to 0.0) and the eviction watermark is set to 80%.
conbody.codeblock: Please enter the list of locators used by Geode members to discover each other. The format is a comma-separated list of host[port]. Default ' ':
conbody.p: The above property specifies the list of locators.
conbody.codeblock: Please enter the name of the file used to log Geode messages. Default 'gemfire_modules.log':
conbody.p: The above property determines the file name for the log file.
conbody.codeblock: Applicable to the geode-p2p template ONLY: Please specify whether to rebalance the Geode cache at startup. Default 'false':
conbody.p: This property allows you to rebalance a partitioned cache when a new peer starts up.
conbody.codeblock: Please enter the name of the file used to store Geode statistics. Default 'gemfire_modules.gfs':
conbody.p: The above property determines the filename for the statistics file.
conbody.codeblock: Please specify whether Geode statistic sampling should be enabled. Default 'false':
conbody.p: The above property determines whether statistics sampling should occur. See for more information.
